page.title: 02DALBEATTIE FLOOD PREVENTION
page.content: On October 31st 1977 Dalbeattie experienced a very severe flood.It damaged people's property and caused a lot of inconvenience.A few years later grants were awarded by the government and the E.E.C. and from then the{Flood Prevention Scheme started up.Consultants were called in to devise a scheme.This was accepted and the work was completed.At first it was to cost Â£300,000 but this soared up to Â£1.2 million.The banks of the Bar Burn, which flows through the town, were built up to a great height and bridges were raised too.Opinion in the town is divided.Some people think it was a waste of money and others think it has improved Dalbeattie.Some people think it has ruined the landscape but they aren't the ones whose houses were flooded and damaged!
